docs.abstract: What should be more important to women: A positive body image or a fit physique that is less at risk for diabetes and other health issues?
docs.snippet: What should be more important to women: A positive body image or a fit physique that is less at risk for diabetes and other health issues?

headline.main: Post Your Questions on Healthy (and Tasty) Eating

docs.abstract: The journalist and author of "Culinary Intelligence: The Art of Eating Healthy (And Really Well)" will answer reader questions on how to relish the act of eating without sending your body into a tailspin.
docs.snippet: The journalist and author of "Culinary Intelligence: The Art of Eating Healthy (And Really Well)" will answer reader questions on how to relish the act of eating without sending your body into a tailspin.

headline.main: The Older Kids Get, The Less Healthfully They Eat

docs.abstract: Between grades 5 and 10, the older students are, the worse their eating habits are likely to be. Are we giving teenagers too much freedom to feed themselves?
docs.snippet: Between grades 5 and 10, the older students are, the worse their eating habits are likely to be. Are we giving teenagers too much freedom to feed themselves?

docs.abstract: Editorial cites a study of overweight and obese children published in The New England Journal of Medicine that has found that Type 2 diabetes progresses faster and is harder to treat in young people than in adults; criticizes Congressional Republicans for attempting to dismantle health care reforms that could greatly assist in curbing the obesity epidemic.
docs.lead_paragraph: The virulence of Type 2 diabetes in children is yet another reason to fight childhood obesity.
docs.snippet: The virulence of Type 2 diabetes in children is yet another reason to fight childhood obesity.

headline.main: Youth Football: The Debate and the Dangers

docs.abstract: Researchers have found that some head impacts in youth football are equal in force to some of the bigger hits in college football.
docs.snippet: Researchers have found that some head impacts in youth football are equal in force to some of the bigger hits in college football.

headline.main: How McDonald’s Came Back Bigger Than Ever

docs.abstract: Keith O'Brien article examines McDonald's launch of a major rebranding effort with new food and revamped decor; notes effort is attempt to come back from series of public relations debacles in an increasingly health-conscious time.
docs.lead_paragraph: With new food, revamped décor and an embrace of mommy blogs, McDonald’s isn’t just trying to keep its customers. It’s trying to convince skeptics that they’re wrong.
docs.snippet: With new food, revamped décor and an embrace of mommy blogs, McDonald’s isn’t just trying to keep its customers. It’s trying to convince skeptics that they’re wrong.

headline.main: The Power Players of New York: Health

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Thomas A. Farley, the city's health commissioner, is the man behind those graphic anti-obesity ads on the subway, the crackdown on smoking at parks and beaches, and arguably the demise of the communal cheese pot at Sardi's. Dr. Farley and Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, a calorie-conscious ex-smoker, may not always be the first to carry out initiatives like posting letter grades for restaurants (Los Angeles, for example, had already done that), but with New York as their testing ground, they have an outsize influence on the public health policy conversation around the globe. (And laugh all you want, but since 2000, two years before Mr. Bloomberg took office, the life expectancy for New Yorkers at birth has risen by nearly three years, compared with about 1.5 years nationwide.) At meetings, Dr. Farley said, his staff is often approached by health officials from other places, ''and they'll say, 'What's the next big idea?' ''

headline.main: The Power Players of New York

docs.abstract: New York Times reporters identify some of the most powerful figures in the New York region and explains why they wield political influence and ambition. Photos (L)1
docs.lead_paragraph: For this special issue, the Metropolitan section asked the reporters who cover the New York region to identify the powerful figures on their beats, and to explain what gave them clout and where they fell on the chain of influence in New York. A separate article identifies those figures who earned the highest spot in our power pantheon: heavy hitters. The rest, arranged alphabetically below, are either established players or rising stars. Design | Antenna Design (Rising Star)
